title: Lincolnshire Wolds Way - Circular Walk Route

images.title: Tim Heaton / View across site of medieval village of Biscathorpe
images.caption: View across site of medieval village of Biscathorpe. Very little to see in terms of the old village. But a nice view across the River Bain towards the church of St Helen

images.title: David Wright / Grim's Mound
images.caption: Grim's Mound. Grim's Mound is a well preserved round barrow situated adjacent to the Viking Way footpath at an elevation of 120m.

description: This circular walk explores the Lincolnshire Wolds AONB, visiting numerous pretty villages, parks and hills. It runs for just under 80 miles, following a series of public footpaths and quiet country lanes through some lovely scenery. Starting in Louth the walk takes you through the settlements of Legbourne, Burwell, Swaby, South Ormsby, Somersby, Salmonby, Fulletby, Belchford, Scamblesby, Goulceby, Donington on Bain, Biscathorpe, Grim's Mound, South Cadeby, Wykeham, Ludford, Tealby, Walesby, Normanby le Wold, Nettleton, Rothwell, Cuxwold, Hatcliffe, East Ravendale, Wold Newton, the sites of Beesby village and Cadeby village and South Elkington. Route highlights include the lovely Hubbard's Hills, a country park located in Louth. For an alternative circular route that is suitable for both cyclists and walkers see the Lindsey Trail page. Scroll down for the full list of walks in and around the Lincolnshire Wolds.
